title: Warning issued for heavy rain in several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for heavy rain in the North western, Central, Uva, and Sabaragamuwa provinces.

title: 58 arrested over online scams by CID at Narahenpita
byline: A group of 58 Sri Lankans suspected to be involved in online financial frauds have been arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) at Narahenpita.

title: Gaza women, children are nearly 70% of verified war dead, UN rights office says
byline: The U.N. Human Rights Office said on Friday nearly 70% of the fatalities it has verified in the Gaza war were women and children, and condemned what it called a systematic violation of the fundamental principles of international humanitarian law.

title: President’s Secretary orders urgent probe into salinity barrier’s role in Matara flooding
byline: A special discussion was held at the Presidential Secretariat, led by Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake the Secretary to the President, and attended by officials from the Irrigation Department, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, and related Ministries.

title: Chairman and Vice Chairman appointed for Elpitiya PS
byline: A Gazette Extraordinary has been issued, officially appointing the Chairman and Vice Chairman for the Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, in the Galle District, under Section 66B (1) of the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance.

title: 58 arrested in Colombo by CID over online scams
byline: A group of 58 Sri Lankans suspected to be involved in online financial fraud have been arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) at Havelock Road in Colombo.

title: Chinese funds transferred to Treasury for disaster relief and monitoring project
byline: The People’s Republic of China has provided financial assistance totaling approximately Rs. 30 million to compensate for damage to houses and properties caused by natural disasters from January 1 to October 30, 2024. This amount has been forwarded to the Treasury, according to the PMD.

title: Beyoncé leads 2025 Grammy noms, becoming most nominated artist in history
byline: Welcome to Beyoncé country. When it comes to the 2025 Grammy Award nominations, “Cowboy Carter” rules the nation. She leads the nods with 11, bringing her career total to 99 nominations. That makes her the most nominated artist in Grammy history.

title: Embankment collapse at DS Senanayake College in Kandy puts classes at risk
byline: A large embankment at D.S. Senanayake College in Kandy has collapsed, causing damages to multiple classrooms.

title: At least 24 killed in Pakistan train station bomb blast, police say
byline: At least 24 people were killed and more than 40 injured in a bomb blast at a railway station in Quetta in southwestern Pakistan on Saturday, police and other officials told Reuters.

title: Sluice gates opened at Polgolla Reservoir in Kandy
byline: Two sluice gates of the Polgolla Reservoir in Kandy have been opened following heavy rainfall.

title: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ offers path to desired political change in Sri Lanka – Dilith
byline: The leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Gampaha District parliamentary candidate Dilith Jayaweera stated that the alliance has created an opportunity for the people to make the choice needed to bring about Sri Lanka’s desired political change.

title: More details revealed on 58 arrested over online scams at luxury apartment in Colombo
byline: More information has been revealed about a group of 58 Sri Lankans who were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on suspicion of involvement in committing online financial fraud.

title: Iranian charged over plot to kill Trump was also told to target Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka - US
byline: The U.S. Department of Justice has on Friday charged an “Iranian asset Farhad Shakeri,” who is accused in a plot to assassinate then-presidential candidate Donald Trump, and claim that he was also tasked with targeting Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka.

title: Shooting incident reported near Lotus Tower
byline: A shooting incident was reported during a musical concert held near the Lotus Tower in Colombo yesterday (08).

title: Govt denies reports of shutting down ‘Thriposha’ company
byline: The government says that reports claiming that Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited (SLTL) is to be closed down are false.

title: Universities closed on Nov. 13 and 14
byline: The University Grants Commission (UGC) says that all universities across the island will remain closed on November 13 and 14, in view of the 2024 General Election.

title: President reveals plans to reduce electricity tariff by over 30%
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that steps will be taken to reduce the electricity tariff by more than 30 percent in the near future.

title: Election complaints surge ahead of parliamentary poll
byline: The number of complaints received by the Election Commission in relation to the upcoming 2024 Parliamentary Poll has further increased.

title: ‘Investment scam’ operating out of luxury apartment in Colombo defrauded over Rs. 300 mln
byline: The Computer Crime Investigation Division (CCID) of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has uncovered a large-scale online financial scams racket in Colombo.
